fields.value: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae

authorAffiliation.value: National Center for Emerging and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, Georgia, USA/Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA

dsDescriptionValue.value: We sequenced the genomes of eight isolates from various regions of the United States that show high sequence similarity to Vibrio sp. 2521-89, a recently reported genome(1). These isolates form a monophyletic cluster clearly related but distinct from V. cholerae, representing a highly divergent basal lineage or a potential novel species.

publicationCitation.value: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae. Liang K et al 2018. MRA submitted.

files.description: Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and in-silico DNA-DNA Hybridization (isDDH) for all pairwise comparisons between representative Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight isolates.
files.label: Vibrio_metaData.xlsx
